metadata.name: Deterministic Reranking - Conservative
metadata.source_paper: Fairness-Aware Ranking in Search & Recommendation Systems with Application to LinkedIn Talent Search \cite{geyik2019fairness}

description.method_description: If there are any groups for which the minimum representation constraint is violated, choose the element with the highest score among those groups. Otherwise, among groups that do not violate the maximum constraint, pick the group that minimizes $ \frac{\lceil p_a * k \rceil}{p_a} $. From this group, choose the element with the highest score.

pipeline.model_description: Deterministic Reranking takes as input a list of output scores (for a each member of a list of candidates) of a ranker. Candidates are by convention assumed to be ordered by decreasing score by the initial ranker.

fairness.fairness_description: The Deterministic Reranker allows to set a desired proportion $p_a$ per demographic group $ a $. Given k samples, the algorithm ensures that the number of selected candidates from each group $n_a$ satisfies $ \lfloor p_a * k \rfloor \leq n_a \leq \lceil p_a * k \rceil $.

implementation.description: The dataset must be passed in the AIF360 used format.

use_cases.description: The original paper also tested the method on a proprietary dataset.
